data.title: Always great and delicious authentic Italian food!
data.text: I love the classic Italian atmosphere. The staff are always gracious and speedy. We ordered the Cheese Pizza with extra cheese, light sauce and lightly cooked! So buttery and tasty! Always order their dinner salad with their homemade Italian house dressing. I usually get a bottle to go of this delicious dressing! And their bread.....OMG fresh made daily baked white bread. Words cannot describe!

data.title: Everything has changed, and not for the better
data.text: I have been coming to this Dicicco's since I was a little kid. While I was growing up, my parents were friends with the owners and we used to come here frequently. Once their sauce changed a couple of decades back, I started going to other Dicicco's instead. We mainly would order takeout pizza from here. Recently, we found a Groupon that we had for this Dicicco's and decided to use it when we ordered our pizza. When my husband got there to pick the pizza up he was told that they would not accept the Groupon because management had changed. The manager stood there and ignored my husband while talking to the person working at the front counter and having her relay things to my husband. Their pizza is now so far beyond overpriced, and the management was so rude that night, that we will never be dining here again.

data.title: Met with friends for Sunday lunch!
data.text: Very pleased with the food & service. Would go back! Waitress very polite & helpful. Quiet enough to visit.

data.title: Not impressed
data.text: Went in for dinner was not impressed at all...long wait to be seated (20-30 mins), the waiting section is so cramped and limited it has a full elevator feeling and the food was not as great as I expected. Our bread was warm but the butter was hard as a rock...it tore the bread attempting to spread it on and my fettuccine was really dry..I asked for a side of extra sauce and waitress brought me a small container about a tablespoon portion. Our waitress came to the table twice to take our order and to bring my sauce...we waited for our check but she never checked on us or brought our check so we went up to the register to ask for it and paid. We gave the tip to the guy who brought our food out (who works in the kitchen area Not a waiter). The place is small and loud because of its confined quarters. Will never visit this place again

data.title: Great local Italian food
data.text: We love Italian food, and especially the calzones. We frequent this restaurant, both dine in and take out.  The lasagna is excellent, and the bread is always delicious. Prices are very reasonable.

data.title: An Old Favorite
data.text: About 20 years ago, when we still had 5 kids in the house, we'd go here and get a large cheese pizza using a coupon for $9.99.  They give you FREE bread (very yummy) and back then they'd also give us red sauce for dipping.  By the time the pizza came, we weren't that hungry and would wind up taking half of it home.  It was cheaper than eating at McDonalds!  The calzones are deep fried and are so much better than everywhere else where they're baked (OK, so maybe they're not as healthy... but oh, they taste good).

data.title: My favorite location for Calzone
data.text: I have beeen going here for years .  These are the bast calzones you can get.  They also have a really nice lounge attached that has great drinks!

data.title: Not worth the time or money!
data.text: Where do I begin? This place is marginal at best but charges like it imports it's bad food from Italy. The service was slow and knew nothing about customer service. It looked like a nice place and had a good atmosphere but everything else was terrible. Go up on Shaw street to some of the other Italian places.

data.title: Always great service with great food.
data.text: Always great service with great food.  My husband and I go at least once a week.  We love it.  Very Clean, fast, reasonable prices.

data.title: Decent Pizza & Salad
data.text:
I was in the mood for pizza & a salad. Found it here, I had their house name pizza, plenty of meat, onion & bell pepper. I thought the onion was a bit strong. Salad was nice with some good extras. I asked for Blue Cheese dressing & was asked if I wanted Blue Cheese crumbles in addition to the "Blue Cheese Ranch", no one told me of the small extra charge for the crumbles. Just a diner's surprise of $.99, I think they should tell you if you incurring an extra charge. Pizza crust was crisp and a bit tough, couldn't cut it with a fork. I've had better. 

Maybe just an off day for me.. tomorrow night I'll try spmewhere else.

data.title: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE
data.text: Drove thirty minutes and my food was not accurate.  I left with only half my order and with spending almost $100.00 I would have thought they would have offered to bring it to my house but, instead I spent another 30 minutes driving back to pick up the other half of the order.  The hostess was rude, didn't offer compensation.  Trust me I will not be dining there again.

data.title: Fantastic meal!
data.text: We went hoping for a light meal and were perfectly delighted. The smiling waitress made a few suggestions and we settled on the spinach ravioli with artichokes and a house salad. How delicious! Then we proceeded to order the cream brûlée. Not exactly light, but the perfect finish to a scrumptious meal.

data.title: Mama Mia...they are the best little local Italiano
data.text: Bon giorno and mange. The food is splendid and they can even create a seafood salad to die for. Mama Mia, go for friendly, romantic, and business setting. They can do it all. locals work there and take pride. They show it!        Mama Mia, that's a tasty Italian.

data.title: Home Delivery
data.text:
I ordered dinner to be delivered to where I was staying. The girl on the phone was sweet and helped me since their web menu was not working. I ordered a large garden salad with ranch and meatballs, peppers with sauce. They said it would take an hour and it arrived a bit under that time.The delivery guy was friendly and the hot food was hot. 
The meatballs (3) were tender and moist. They were very salty though.
The onions & peppers were plentiful and still had a bit of a bite to them.
The sauce was good but a little on the greasy side. It came with 2 nice slices if Italian bread. The salad was ok. I am not a fan of big chunks of iceberg lettuce but the ranch dressing was good. would have been nice to have some tomatoes on it. All in all it was good.

data.title: 3rd disappointment, won't return
data.text:
I love Dicicco's in Sanger and call in orders to pick up frequently. The Clovis location has done nothing but disappoint. They either get the order wrong, forget the bread, or both. Here's what happened this time:
PROs:
-they put the order together quickly
-friendly greeting

CONs:
- it smelled like smoke inside the restaurant. As I was leaving, I saw several young employees hanging around a side entrance, smoking.
- I ordered a large soup and salad to go. On the phone, I was told that it came with their homemade bread. After I picked it up, I checked the bag before driving away-no bread. 
-When I went back, they put a few extra slices of bread in the bag, and the bread tasted fresh, but it had a funky smell...like...mold..? Unwashed pans...?.I'm not sure, but it wasn't good. 
-I also noticed the soup was small. When I went back, I asked if I'd received the large soup I ordered, and was told that it was a bowl of soup, the largest size they have. Hmm. The one in Sanger is almost twice that size. Same price. 
-The soup is also different. It's still minestrone, but it does not have potato, celery, or carrot pieces like other locations. It has kidney beans, some other kind of bean, and parsley  instead. It also has considerably more black pepper. It isn't necessarily bad, just different. 
-I received the Cesar side salad I'd ordered, but no Cesar dressing, which I'd requested on the phone. 
-I paid $2 tip for the packaging. I guess I should've looked first to see exactly what I was getting before tipping them. 
-Also, when I went back for the bread, my signed credit card receipt was still sitting on the counter in plain view. 

In sum, I won't return to this site. I believe the other Dicicco's locations are very good. This Clovis location seems to be staffed by a bunch of unmonitored teens who care more about lighting up on their smoke breaks than doing their jobs. Ew.

data.title: Big Goupon Disappointment
data.text: Thought I was getting a really good deal when purchasing a $40 Goupon for $20, but I was wrong. Went to dinner with the family tonight at this Clovis Di Cicco' s for the first time and was very disappointed. Where do I start? Well our order was taken, but when our food arrived my order and my daughter's order was incorrect. And when we informed our waiter he said the order was right because he had written it down. I then told him he was mistaken because our daughter's order had meat and she is a vegetarian. The bread corner of my wife's meatball sandwich was brunt as was a small portion of my lasagna, while my rigatoni pasta was undercooked! So needless to say we won't be back to this location. Divisadero/Abby location never disappointed us like this. And the food at the Blackstone/Barstow location we visited a short while back using a Goupon was good.

data.title: Always a Favorite
data.text: The pizza is always the best, but the salads have lost their pizzazz.  The dressing is too strong and too heavy.  Otherwise, it is the same great place we have been eating a since the 60s.

data.title: Consistently Great!
data.text:
The bread and pasta are delicious. We appreciate the gf options and have always enjoyed eating here. 

Today we had spaghetti and chicken parmesiana. Both were great.

data.title: Good and budget-friendly
data.text:
I'm not a big fan of heavy pasta, but I like this chain. There are many DiCicco's across the Fresno area, and they're consistent in their menu, prices, and service. 
The menu has many pastas with different add-in options and white or red sauce. The customer can substitute red sauce for white or vice versa for most dishes. I like the calzones. They are large and like a pizza (some customers prefer just getting a pizza). The calzones are served drowned in red sauce, so if u don't want that much sauce, just ask for it on the side or without. 
I like the salads. The side salad is fairly large and has pieces of ham or salami, cheese chunks, and cucumber, and sometimes a few black olives are on the salad. 
I often order the soup and salad for my meal. The house soup is vegetable minestrone with large chunks of carrot, zucchini, potato, celery in a flavorful broth. They also have clam chowder, I believe, but I've never ordered it. 

The bread is everyone's favorite. Fresh-baked loaves...not sure what kind...probably Italian loaf. ..served at your table when you order. I only order the soup and salad because I stuff my face greedily with half a loaf of bread. 
I also like the chicken Caesar salad. Large, with about 8 grilled chicken strips, I think it costs around $7 or $8. 

I order to go from a DiCicco's near my work fairly often and pick it up on my way home. 

In sum, it's not a fancy-shmancy gourmet restaurant (like Campagnia's or FIVE in northern Fresno [Champlain and Perrin area], or like Macaroni Grill in Riverpark - those restaurants have beautiful decor, and gourmet pasta with gourmet prices. They are all very good.), but it is good food in a casual Italian decorated atmosphere that you can enjoy with family or friends. 

Hope that helps! 
Bon appetit!

data.title: great selections of great food
data.text:
We have  been here many times and enjoyed it each & every
Time.  Great food & atmosphere and very friendly people.
